attributes.action: prevent the Premier League from taking English club football games abroad.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Reports from the BBC suggest that the English Premier League intends to introduce an extra league game per club per season, to be played outside of the UK. (see http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/eng_prem/7232390.stm )

We believe that this new proposal could damage English football. We have the following objections:

* The proposals for extra games beyond the current 'home-away' system would go against over 100 years of tradition and would add a random, unfair element into each season

* The extra game would damage the England national football team by adding to an already full fixture schedule

* Holding matches abroad would further distance players and clubs from their fans

* The increased revenue from the games would only suit to enlarge the gap between the richest and poorest clubs in England

reasons: Outside the remit of the Prime Minister and Government
